section.title: Synopsis
Description
section.p: Use rename to establish a new name (the string at new) for a file now known by the string at old. After a successful rename, the file is no longer accessible by the string at old.
If rename fails, the file named *old is unaffected. The conditions for failure depend on the host operating system.
The alternate function _rename_r is a reentrant version. The extra argument reent is a pointer to a reentrancy structure.

section.title: Returns
section.p: The result is either 0 (when successful) or -1 (when the file could not be renamed).
